attributes.comment:
To Whom it May Concern:
I strongly oppose the increase in fees for immigration applications. The fees
are already out of the reach of many immigrants. I personally know immigrants
who qualify for benefits but cannot apply because they cannot pay the fees as
they stand. Doubling and, in some cases, tripling of these fees will only
prevent more people from applying for benefits. Not only is this an unfair
burden, it only serves to further increase the population of undocumented
individuals in the US. The larger this population gets, the easier it will be
for terrorists to hide within the US. This will create a larger and larger ring
of counterfeiters of driver's licenses, social security numbers, etc. It will
encourage identity theft and tax law enforcement resources rather than allowing
them to focus on real threats to our peace and order. The Immigration Service
should be adopting policies, as well as fees, that encourage individuals to come
forward, out of the shadows. There are no other government benefits that
require such an enormous fee or that have increased at such a dramatic rate over
the past 10 years. The rate increases have far exceeded the rate of inflation
and have not resulted in any increase in quality of service or greater
accountability of those in the US. The fee increases are unconscionable.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jeffrey Martins, Law Office of Jeffrey Martins
